website_summaries.verdict: Portability and very low price are the selling points here, but the quality is surprisingly good too.
pros: Very portable, affordable and surprisingly high magnification from such a small unit
cons: Must be used on perfectly flat surface to work well
Unlike larger units, doesn't provide lighting from below for slide viewing

customer_reviews.title: lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: i actually bought this so i can inspect plant resin on my flowers to see when they are ready to harvest. but i find it's so easy to get carried away with it. wall's, carpet, leaves, pet fur, sugar on the table, bugs, dirt, lol if it was in my house i inspected it. it's lots of fun. i only wish i could see the air on a microscopic level. but we cant have everything. all in all its a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: jessie

customer_reviews.title: Very handy.
customer_reviews.text: Had this a few years, now, and it's just always there for me. There aren't many reasons a normal person needs this for, but it definitely helped me when, say, I was learning to sharpen knives. I could look at the grain of the bevel and look for wire edges and such. I used it on a few coins I thought were rare (kinda mad at the microscope, cause it showed me I was wrong), and just little things like that that crop up.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Very Amateur
customer_reviews.text: If you're trying to use this for anything serious, don't. Spend the money and get a proper tool. This one is made of plastic and the magnification isn't strong enough to be useful when closely inspecting buds or blooms. It would be a great gift for a kid--budding naturalists could easily use to get a closer look at plants and bugs...but it's not for the serious user.
customer_reviews.author: Diablita

customer_reviews.title: Small, Low quality, very limited field of view
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful this would be at the very least acceptable. I wanted to use it to spot flaws in silver coins, art pieces, etc. so I could examine them further with a more powerful microscope. The unit is difficult to focus and stay focused. Its field of view is extremely small. Looks and feels like a toy one would get in a kids meal. I gave it to the grandkids and bought the Celestron handheld pro.
customer_reviews.author: D Holser

customer_reviews.title: Great for tomatoes!
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for what i needed it for. For some reason it only came with 2 of the three batteries so i just stuck a little piece of metal in there as a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: zportukalian

customer_reviews.title: Usesess
customer_reviews.text: This thing does not function like the vieo shows, worthless
customer_reviews.author: wade sample

customer_reviews.title: Perfection in a pocket device.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is small, and fits in the pocket easily. Sometimes I'm in need of great detail. This device provides what I need, with minimal fuss, minimal cost, minimal maintenance, in other words, perfect for my lifestyle. If you're in need of great detail while out and about, or even at home, this device won't disappoint you. Just remember, it's like 10 bucks, it's not going to take pictures, it won't wirelessly search google for matching items, it's a simplistic LED lit 60x-100x microscope that is pocket friendly. 20 years ago, field physicists and archaeologists would have killed for this. Now, we appreciate it solely as a novelty.
customer_reviews.author: Malakkar Vohryzek

customer_reviews.title: Good for bills & stamps, not so much for flowers
customer_reviews.text: Finicky to use, I could only properly use it when I had a flat surface, steady hand, and literally had this pressed on top of whatever I was looking at. I could not use this to search for amber on the plants because I had to squish the leaves against the scope to see them, and by the time you focus the plant has moved in your hand. A dollar bill, on the other hand, I could view just fine (although still not ideal). If you are looking for trichomes I recommend using a jeweler's loupe instead of this. I got a 10x and it works for finding orange a lot better than this. Same price point too.
customer_reviews.author: M L

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't leave a good thing be: some genius had to reduce the power by 25%
customer_reviews.text: Used to be 100X which was barely enough now some yoyo has reduced it to 75 power. No. 1 rule of manufacturing design today: "If it ain't broke get in there and **** with it!!!"
customer_reviews.author: Odn

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy it. Don't try to save a few dollars on this pocket microscope thinking you will see anything clear. You will not. When you do get your object in view and in focus, you will realize that paying more for actual glass is worth it over this poly whatever it is warped out of focus view this gives you. Go elsewhere. You will use it for a few minutes only to get frustrated over the amount of work involved getting something into field of view and focus then it will sit around wasting space never to be used again except to fill your local landfill.
customer_reviews.author: Micefreak

customer_reviews.title: Gave me a migraine!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the biggest pice of crap I ever seen.. it works kinda ok if you can set it down flat on a table and use it... but if your trying to look at something that's not flat.. good luck... gave me a migraine trying to use it... just get a regular jewelry loup.
customer_reviews.author: Mckee Family

customer_reviews.title: Impressive scope for the money
customer_reviews.text: After having problems with a 7g iPod nano, I decided to a close look at the pins. Most jewelers loupes do not sufficient magnification to look at such fine detail. The only problem I had with this scope is breaking of the clear stabilizer/space, which broke when I attempted to remove it. In my case, I needed to have more control of the depth of focus than the clear plastic piece would allow as I was looking into something. One of the taps broke on removal. One tip -- use this in a totally dark room and use the internal light or even more powerful spot LED lighting. It can get tricky when looking deep into cavities.
customer_reviews.author: P. Scott Pope

customer_reviews.title: Useful instrument.
customer_reviews.text: Takes practice to scroll the coarser focus first, then use the finer focus while holding the short magnifier still. Line up your object under the center of the coarse focus wheel. A bit more magnification than I need for most use.
customer_reviews.author: ns

customer_reviews.title: Great mini microscope!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this mini microscope is GREAT! I bought it to examine trichomes up close and also had some fun looking at other things as well. (My cat’s whisker is shown in the picture I left with this review). Would recommend 100%, great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Samson

customer_reviews.title: Very sensitive but crisp
customer_reviews.text: Super convenient and neatly-made. A bit too sensitive to movement. I have a slight tremor, and unlike other scopes I use for bio, the slightest millisecond of a small tremor while looking through the eyepiece (stabilized in place) loses the entire picture. Once you get the picture, it’s pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality optics make sharp focus impossible.
customer_reviews.text: The good: -"Pocket microscope" is a very apt description. The unit is about the size of an average adult's pointer and middle fingers pressed together. -It's entirely plastic, but professional looking, and solidly built. -The LED lamp is nice and bright. Time will tell how long the batteries last. The bad: -The lens optics are so poor, that it's impossible to sharply focus on anything. Terrible chromatic aberration. I had a cheap toy microscope as a child that looked better than this. Overall rather disappointed in the purchase. You get what you pay for; it's so cheap, it's not worth the time and cost of shipping to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great Portability - Price is Right
customer_reviews.text: Love this one as well as my MicroBrite, A little smaller, more compact, and is a great backup for those places the larger one can't get to. Quick and very easy to use. I use this mainly in the field to aid in identification any tiny critters I come across ( a hobby of mine - biology major). Not sure how it will hold up to rough handling, and since the price was right, I purchased 2 of them. Leave one at home on the workbench, and never leave home without the other.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I need a case of these to give out to people.
customer_reviews.text: I pull it out to use it randomly, as I ordered it just as a new toy. This thing is amazing. For the price I wasn't expecting an electron microscope, and I didn't receive one. What I did get was the exact same thing pictured. Its simple, it works, and when people see it I can't seem to keep my own hands on it, so you may want to order more than 1. I also didn't expect to become a scientist over night by ordering a sub $50 pocket microscope, and unfortunately that didn't happen either, but at least I got a cool microscope that everyone else likes as well.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M

customer_reviews.title: Not for adults
customer_reviews.text: Trash. It's a kids toy, Super disappointed. Maybe mine is broken but there is a black shadow in the lense and you cant focus all the way in.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Moonbeam

customer_reviews.title: Nice tiny microscope, a little too much zoom for trichomes in-hand
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great once you get the hang of it. Because of the magnification, it's nearly impossible to use the microscope while holding it in your hand -- just breathing can cause you to totally lose what you were looking at. Best to use it on a stable surface such as a desk, table, etc.. Sidenote: for MMJ growers, the magnification is a little too much for looking at buds and difficult to get a good fix on the trichomes while holding the microscope. Better go for something more like 30x zoom just to make your life easier.
customer_reviews.author: McGinley

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works good was a little hard to figure out how to hold and position where you could see clearly. If it wasn’t for that I would give a five star. Also it wasn’t clear on what type batteries to buy for it but you can look on the internet and find a site that takes the number on the scope and gives you a energizer number that interchanges.
customer_reviews.author: RMS

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth $1 at Dollar Tree
customer_reviews.text: Junk! Cheap! LED light has the power of a twinkling star 3,000 light years away and item I assume is broken because I cannot focus on anything. Only microscope I ever used that never focused. Returning to Amazon,
customer_reviews.author: Morris Codex

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: I'm stunned at how useful and interesting this is. Since I got it, we've used it to stare at every surface and object in our house. Everything is interesting on the smaller scale. The focus and magnifcation knobs are both easy to use, but could stand to be a little looser for one handed use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not Good For Everything
customer_reviews.text: The advertising states that "making it easy to examine blood samples, bugs, and anything else that's worthy of a closer look.". This is not the case. It is not useful unless you can lay the microscope on a flat object, such as paper, stamps, coins, calligraphy, etc. For three-dimensional things, it is impossible to get a focus, due to the extremely thin plane of focus, and the shaking of your hands, however steady they may be. For flat objects, I would give it 5 stars, due to the extreme close-up view that it is possible to achieve. I took stars off for misleading advertising.
customer_reviews.author: H. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Great for my son
customer_reviews.text: I have two sons 6 and 3 years old - both enjoy the microscope (3 year old needs a little bit help). This is a great microscope for kids who will find 'formal' microscopes too cumbersome. I have taken some microscopic pictures with my phone - will upload them soon. The built quality is good, we've already dropped it couple of times with no problem at all. The unit is much smaller than depicted in the pictures therefore could be carried anywhere. I would have preferred AAA batteries as the button cells included will be expensive (we are still using the same battery set that came with the unit - 4 weeks already used). Overall, very satisfied with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: M Mustharshid

customer_reviews.title: light works good.. it's very small but it works with ...
customer_reviews.text: I gave them as small gifts to an 8 year old.& 10year old... I focused it..that took a little while to get it right.. it.we looked at onion skin cells...peeled the inside of onion piece came out thin enough to see long pointed cells..light works good..it's very small but it works with some effort. I think it's worth the money... even a savy farmer could use it out in the field or orchard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great product!
customer_reviews.text: Does everything it says it will. an awesome microscope no doubt and worth every penny if you are a grower of some sort, or a jeweler maybe. any reason you would need a microscope on a regular basis I would fully recommend trying this one out. It may take a minute or so to get used to adjusting the focus for different distances but once you get that down it is a super clear picture, wonderful this happen that we never get to see in the growing world and this makes it possible to retain all the visual knowledge possible.
customer_reviews.author: TacticSurvival

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great product.
customer_reviews.text: As far as microscopes go, this device's top magnification of 100X isn't that high, but that is more than made up by it's versatility: You can look at ANY surface (as opposed to only small, thin and transparent specimens), since the light comes from the front, not the back. So far, I've only looked at stuff around the house (couch surface, desk surface, laptop surface, tablecloth, etc), but I am already satisfied by what I've seen (pun). For only $12, this is a great value, and a fun little gadget to have around the house.
customer_reviews.author: AlenK

customer_reviews.title: good buy
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a great little pocket microscope. It is smaller than I expected it to be, but performs very well. Yes the viewing area is small, but what do you expect? This isn't a desktop model. I bought one for my girlfriend and ended up having so much fun with it that I had to buy another for myself! I suggest keeping the box it comes in for storage, since it has no lens covers. My only complaint is that the light is a bit too bright for looking at some things with shiny surfaces (like waxy leaves or metal)
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Meibaum

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to get this thing to focus at times. The knobs are rather stiff and cause you to shake then looking. The hole for your eye is rather small so If your eyes are bad good luck peering through that thing.
customer_reviews.author: pedro zollinger

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, well.....after purchasing this to look at trichomes on the developing buds of my marijuana plants (we're allowed 4 per residence here in Oregon), I went and bought a real microscope. This thing takes some getting used to, but it does work just fine. I'm giving it an "It's Okay."
customer_reviews.author: Jacob A.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad!
customer_reviews.text: This little guy can magnify things quite well! Perhaps a little too well for the hand-held nature of it. I never knew I moved my hands so much when trying to hold something in place. As long as you set both it and the subject matter down, it's doable - but handheld is difficult. I wasn't impressed with the zoom feature. Seems to introduce a blurriness to the image. Still, it's worth it for checking stuff out and getting a unique perspective.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Conner

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: Very Small, smaller than expected :) works great! Very handy to dig a little deeper ..
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: awesome tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one because it was cheaper than the 420 scope..which I have..the only 2 differences there are between the 2 are the 420 is about 13.00 dollars more and it has a cool little sticker on the front...the added bonus was the little jewlers loop that came with the order. The led light last alot longer than the regular bulbs...which are crap..and the little button batteries are alot better than AAA batteries, they last longer. I'd reccommend this to anyone that needs a good deal on a useful tool, you definitly get your money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: blackdog

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Tool!
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews on THIS scope and the 420 Scope - and read that many didn't know which would be better. I ordered both after reading a few negative 420 scope reviews in case the 420 scope was a dud. I can say without a doubt - they are EXACTLY the same except a 420 logo was slapped on one of them. They both perform equally as well and would recommend either one.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for the price
customer_reviews.text: What do you expect for a dozen dollars? It focuses, the image is pretty clear, and the LED really works to make this thing useful. I admit that I'm used to much much better equipment and, at first, was disappointed. No reticule showing the sizes of stuff, no camera hookup, ... Then I realized that this little microscope costs maybe a percent of what the units I'm used to cost. Anyways, this is a nice little expendable unit that I won't hesitate to hand to a kid, toss in the glove box, or drop into a pack.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Forge

customer_reviews.title: Small, toyish, but useful
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes a magnifying glass just isn't quite powerful enough to identify a tiny insect or to read micro-printing - I bought this to toss in my purse and satisfy my idle curiosity - the microscope is tiny, the field of view is small, focusing is tricky, but after a little fiddling, it works and works well - a serious hobbyist or heavy user would undoubtedly prefer something more substantial (and a lot more dollars) - for $11, this is a great curiosity satisfyer -
customer_reviews.author: Laurence Holbrook

customer_reviews.title: I love this little gem
customer_reviews.text: This little gem helped me tremendously with monitoring harvesting time for my herbal crops. I could not believe how well it worked for the price. It takes a little finessing and getting used to in the beginning but once you're familiar with the adjustments it works like a charm. The only reason I gave this 4 stars was because of the adjustment difficulty.
customer_reviews.author: Khary

customer_reviews.title: Not a very good image
customer_reviews.text: Yet another example of getting what you pay for. If you're considering buying this "microscope", note that the supplied images are actually on the good side of what you'll be able to see. The LED light source produces a sickly blue light that catches reflective edges on nearly anything you look at, meaning that everything you see looks "sparkly". Also, the optics are such that it is nearly impossible to get a sharp plane of focus. While the promises of 60X to 100X magnification are compelling, I would recommend buying a 60X loupe instead that admits more light of a higher quality and probably has a much better lens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pocket microscope
customer_reviews.text: A good product for just the right sized hands. Was too difficult for children in after-school tutoring program to operate. Returned for a different kind that worked out much better for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Madame Bovary

customer_reviews.title: Just ok..
customer_reviews.text: Long as your using on flat surface it's fine but it sucked for active scoping thing that you cant put on a flat surface.
customer_reviews.author: Niko

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little microscope!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little pocket microscope! The first thing that I looked at was the back of a damaged CPU. I was able to see a very large image of the individual pins, even the little scratches on them. The LED light comes from an angle, so it highlights the shapes of objects with a slight shadow. The only thing that I dislike is that the image is inverted, but that's supposed to be normal for a microscope. What a great stocking stuffer for Christmas these would be! Fantastic for the price!!!
customer_reviews.author: daveroller

customer_reviews.title: pocket microscope
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to view very crystal grains in rock samples while in the field, and am very satisfied with this little device. Conveniently, or not-so conveniently small, it's slightly larger than a bic lighter, making it a little tricky to use when trying to view a specific point. As for the LED light, it's blue white, so it distorts color slightly making objects bluish. And as with all magnification, brightness becomes an issue, so the LED should be brighter and whiter. This is a perfect example of technologies that are reaching the limits of human use due to size... any smaller and this magnifier would be unusable. However the size is why I chose this model over others.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin

customer_reviews.title: Good Glass
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves this!! He can see all the detail on his plants!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I am a coin collector, although the grading companies start with a 30x loupe under halogen, I use this before I spend the money to send coins in to be graded. I have found flaws that I did not find at 30x (the graders change to 150x if the coin is selected for possible high grades)I have changed my mind on spending the money to get coins graded after using this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Favata

customer_reviews.title: Not so bad but not too great either
customer_reviews.text: Mixed feelings about this product. Its kind of a PITA trying to play around with the knobs while still looking through the lens. Its easier to adjust and then look, adjust again and then look again, and so on. Once you fiddle with it enough and find the right spot (like any microscope I guess) it'll give you a nice clean image of whatever you're looking at. It definitely works so I can't complain, it just should come with a warning... patience required.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Drew

customer_reviews.title: Foggy lenses
customer_reviews.text: Compared to other microscopes in the same price range, this one falls short. Lenses are low quality and look foggy. I owned a Radio Shack brand that was great, bright and clear, but it's now unavailable. I can't recommend another brand.
customer_reviews.author: M. Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Great Micro-Micro Scope!!!
customer_reviews.text: I carry this product with me everywhere! I love its compact size, I even carry it in the box it came with because it's so small. I've looked at the hairs on my arm, ink on paper, to peanuts! I'd recommend not leaving the light on for extended periods of time as I can imagine that would burn out eventually. This little guy is great! I highly recommend this to people looking for some fun with microscopes. I'm even thinking of buying a more high-tech microscope since I've had so much fun with this one!
customer_reviews.author: JENTHEBRILLIANT

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to beat in this price range
customer_reviews.text: Carson has made a nifty little scope here. It has magnification and focus wheels for an excellent range of vision. The led light is plentiful and brings out colors nicely. I use this little scope for botanical purposes, to determine the flowering stage and ripeness. The 50-60x range is perfect for this purpose. Portability makes this device ideal for field work. Highly recommended. I think this would be an excellent starter scope for young people just beginning their science explorations.
customer_reviews.author: Sean F. Keating

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, works good. Had problems getting it focused at first, but it does work as long as I dont mess with it too much. I would like one that is easier to focus and don't require getting right up on material that I'm magnifing. I would recommend as a good starter microscope/magnifier.
customer_reviews.author: Pippin_410

customer_reviews.title: and got to see the recipient enjoy it numerous times
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift, and got to see the recipient enjoy it numerous times. Worked great right out of the box, and the battery is still going strong. It's great for hand-held items, particularly plants. It's not crazy powerful, but will do for most anything. And best of all, you don't have to worry about it taking up much space. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Grill

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to use and very clear. I can hold my iPhone attach to it and take photos. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Wei

customer_reviews.title: Decent device for the price
customer_reviews.text: This will be perfect for coins and bills. It seems that this is an awesome budget microscope as long as what one is looking at is semi-flat and on something like a table or desk. If you have trouble holding still/focusing/etc. it's probably because it wasn't intended to be held up to the eye, instead put your head to it. I find that using this pocket microscope is pretty easy when you hold it with one hand, and sort of hold the table while using your thumb to focus in with your other hand. Stabilization is key!
customer_reviews.author: TJ McCracken

customer_reviews.title: Did not include all of the batteries like it was supposed to
customer_reviews.text: This item was supposed to come with three button batteries and only came with two. Also, it arrived "on", so even if all of the batteries had of been in the compartment, it would probably be dead by now. Don't know if it works or not because now I will have to wait until I can find another special button battery.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lillard

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 10 year old niece last Christmas and she loved it. Immediately she starting running through the house looking at the kitchen table, the carpet, her brother's head, etc... I will say that it's a bit smaller than I had anticipated... though that worked out well considering it was for a child, I would have a difficult time using it given I have larger hands.
customer_reviews.author: Russell C.

customer_reviews.title: Works but a little difficult to see
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to look at anything unless it is flat on the table. If you want to look at a leave of a plant it does not work unless you pull the leave off the plant and put flat on table.
customer_reviews.author: P Blake

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be a nice little microscope
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to inspect gemstones/rocks. The bottom area is so small that you could only view small stones. I also found it hard to focus. It seems to be a nice little microscope, but I decided to return. I later bought "Carson LumiLoupe 10X Power Stand Magnifier With Dual Lens (LL-20)" and LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: Y. Juan

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little microscope, especially for the money. I've had others like it before, and this one, though made of plastic, feels sturdy and works well. The optics are better than I expected, delivering clear images, and both the zoom and focus knobs are precise. The only con, and what prompted 4 versus 5 stars, is that the built-in light is too bright. It tends to overwhelm whatever you're looking at if it's a light color.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: good but a little too small
customer_reviews.text: It works but it is a little too small and can be hard to see through the eye hole. The light is nice and bright and when you get everything lined up you can get really good views, just takes a little effort.
customer_reviews.author: e. shealy

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I had to buy this to inspect lice on my nieces while they visited for the summer... it worked well but wish I didn’t have to buy it ;)
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good value. Adjusting dials are difficult to adjust while viewing.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Scott

customer_reviews.title: Too small for needs
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Seems well built. Was using for gardening but is too small to focus on moving leaves and branches but the product seems well built.
customer_reviews.author: GudEye

customer_reviews.title: My 5th purchase of this item
customer_reviews.text: So I just bought my 5th one. Why? Not because the wore out, or broke, or had any problems--in fact, the scope is incredibly durable and the battery lasts forever. Not because it is so small and lightweight that it is easy to lose. No, the 5th because so many friends have come over and ended up "borrowing" my scope that I have had to replace it many times! The light is bright and gives true color, it is easy to use, and the price is just right.
customer_reviews.author: Dottie Natal

customer_reviews.title: Good value!
customer_reviews.text: A little awkward to clarify, but gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a couple of years, and I haven't changed the battery (or batteries). The light is important. It would be a hassle without it. Since this has high magnification, it may be a little tricky to get the results you want right away. Learn the adjustment knobs and move slow.
customer_reviews.author: Big Steve from Seymour (by Gawd) Texas

customer_reviews.title: For the price it is pretty cool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my step son. I honestly did not expect much from it because of the price. It is a little smaller than what I expected, but overall it is pretty cool. I think I use it more than him.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hall

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive pocket scope
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, carry and works well for what it is. Slightly longer than your palm, has a built in light and is easy to operate, You will not be able to see the nuclus of a cell, (Would you expect that for a $10 scope?) But you can easily see the individual fibers making up a string in a piece of cloth or the veins in a leaf. The exact sort of thing to thrill your child. I suggest you buy 2 because you will want one for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two small for my eyes
customer_reviews.text: I found that my eye was too big for this Microscope and eyelashes got in the way. Useless for me.
customer_reviews.author: Alex The Great

customer_reviews.title: 4-years of use and still going strong
customer_reviews.text: Can’t beat the magnification for the price. I rely heavily on this for differentiating between nymph ticks and scabs on my kids. Sounds crazy, but if your kids play outside it’s a huge blessing.
customer_reviews.author: Momma C

customer_reviews.title: love love love
customer_reviews.text: This microscope has opened up a whole new world for me ! Its amazing the things you can see with this thing !! Sux h magnification, such precision ! After you choose youre magnification, you then turn the focus knob and focus in whtyou want to take a closer look at ! Once you get the hang of using this its a breeze and becomes second nature to you ! Whatever you're looking at put onto a white piece of paper and turn the light on...no slides needed ! A++++
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: This is not a precision instrument and it's not supposed to be. It's great for what it is designed to do. That is, you can take it out in the boonies to look at bugs and things without worrying about it. Throw it in a pack pocket and go. It functions quite well and the light on it makes it much better than trying to use natural light. I'd recommend it for outdoor exploring for any age. It's also great around the house any time you need extreme magnification.
customer_reviews.author: B. Fails

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use with a decent price
customer_reviews.text: This lighted pocket microscope came in perfect condition. It is a fun and affordable tool if you want to just use it for fun and educating your kids. I LOVE the fact that it has a light, and that is an absolute must have on this size microscope. It is a little awkward to focus and zoom in while keeping it in the exact same spot. However, for what it is and for the price, I would highly recommend it if you're in the market for a small micropscope.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Carson 60x LED magnifier
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit to view cutting edges on tools. This thing really magnifies, I think that I can see the individual molecules that make up a steel drill bit (joking!). However, the unit is handheld and therefore difficult to hold steady enough to gain a clear image. If I rest the magnifier on a firm base it works well. Very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: dgeorge

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely does not work.
customer_reviews.text: Despite my enthusiasm at the quality of the product's build for its price, this microscope never managed to view anything. Absolutely worthless. Hopefully this is a one-off issue and not a regular occurance.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Thurston

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: Nice little scope to carry around while on nature hikes with the kids. Lets them explore some of the more interesting items we come across. Small and easy for kids to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great little MicroScope for the price
customer_reviews.text: Now, be prepared, this baby is small. Like, no longer than my middle finger small....but it does just fine, at full 100x it shows perfectly what you are looking for. It illluminates the viewing space great and provides a perfect quality viewing experience. And when you consider the cost....this thing is a no brainer. Even if you just pick one up for a backup...heck, get two, they are cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Coleman Family

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to check out different specimens from my garden or on hikes...Also wanted kids to see how things looked... You definitely need a slide set to hold samples down or they blow away...also hard to center and find object. Once set it has a nice little lens set and the light is great...I think it is nice for starters to get kids interested or as a pocket lens...
customer_reviews.author: Earthworks

customer_reviews.title: It's a pocket-size microscope
customer_reviews.text: Based on other reviews, I was concerned that it'd be hard to adjust the lens to have clear images. I'm glad I went ahead and bought this tiny microscope. Adjusting the lens is not that hard; I dare saying that it's comparable to other mechanical microscopes. If you're looking for a magnifier, don't buy this microscope because using a microscope isn't as comfortable as using a magnifier. I recommend it to anyone that wants a pocket-size, cheap microscope for hobby applications.
customer_reviews.author: M. Machado

customer_reviews.title: Ooh look at that!
customer_reviews.text: Really handy little microscope. Easy to use and carry along on adventures. Helps us inspect plants, rocks, gold!, silver, crystals, skin, all kinds of stuff. It's like looking into a world within, bringing features to our attention that we wouldn't have noticed otherwise. The led light is helpful most times, but the color is off. Fun to use, even for my 8yo son. Great price. Would recommend. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool!!!
customer_reviews.text: Tiny, very light, (30 g- about the weight of 4 unsharpened pencils), magnifies clearly: a lower case e at sixe 11 times new roman font fills the screen at the 60x, and zooms in from there. The LED is very bright and shows the texture of the printer paper well. I will be ordering another one for my bicycle "go bag" as this one is going in my purse. I can't wait for the kids to come home to see what they examine!
customer_reviews.author: John & Linda Kuzma

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Wished it didn’t have so many focus buttons. Takes a min. To get use to but once you do you can see descent
customer_reviews.author: Kristi H.

customer_reviews.title: If your the type of person that likes to look closer into natures fine detail, (without breaking the bank) then this pocket ...
customer_reviews.text: The microscope is a little higher power then what I needed it for. My mistake. The LED is plenty bright. The overall device is a lot smaller than what I initially thought. For the price, the microscope over achieves my expectations. If your the type of person that likes to look closer into natures fine detail, (without breaking the bank) then this pocket microscope is for you. It is so small I always have it with me. I would recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: zach german

customer_reviews.title: greatest little $12 piece of equipment ever
customer_reviews.text: These little microscopes are the greatest little invention. They do just what they are supposed to do magnify stuff alot. The device is easy to operate, have a great little led, and can be carried in your pocket. I would advise any one wanting a little carry-around microscope to scoop this baby up. I give this device a 4.9 out of 5 rating. I took 1/10 a point off for the small eyehole, but it would be difficult to put a larger eyepiece on this little device. BUY IT.
customer_reviews.author: micpro09

customer_reviews.title: not really a bad product, just didn't fit my needs
customer_reviews.text: not really a bad product, just didn't fit my needs. i was trying to examine plant leaves while they were still on the plant. the view was too shakey at 100X. if you are looking at prepared samples on a steady surface, its great, if you're looking at things in the field, not so much
customer_reviews.author: Clark F.

customer_reviews.title: Buy them for your friends
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the coolest thing I ever purchased from Amazon. Yeah it's made in China and will probably break soon. Yeah, when the tiny little pill batteries die it'll probably be cheaper to buy a new one rather than replace the batteries. It doesn't matter. It was $11 well spent if only for entertainment value or to check your own sperm count.
customer_reviews.author: Bash Q.

customer_reviews.title: work great
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this for over a year. it handy to have and the light is a great feature.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca 4*

customer_reviews.title: Batterys not included only one doesnt work.
customer_reviews.text: Don't know about the quality because this item just arrived and did not have all the batterys only one so I'm not to happy.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Look
customer_reviews.text: These things are so cool. I used it to see so many things close up and it was surprising what I saw. However it is hard to sometimes use the zoom and focus to see what you're trying to see, especially if you're standing or moving. Would Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tonny The Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Magnifies very well
customer_reviews.text: I used it in various applications and once I got used to turning the knobs while holding it, it was fine. It's a bit difficult to get used to turning the knobs while looking at something. Best used on a table or hard surface. Holding it takes some practice if you can't put what you're looking at on a table. The led is in the right place for illumination.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this for looking closely at textile fibers and it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Stonewall Cottage

customer_reviews.title: Great product for kids
customer_reviews.text: This is what you get for the price. Not like the 200$ microscopes but actually did a great job. My kids love it and they now spend hours seeing what everything is made of around them in the world. This is great to throw in a backpack or purse for a field trip. Can't wait till it gets warm to go search outside for what we all find
customer_reviews.author: Ann Fries

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for sharpening knives, but haven't done that yet.... I'm too busy looking at everything else through this thing!! It's built well enough for the price, just take care of it and I can't see any problems arising. I just got it today and it's already paid for itself in pure enjoyment I've gotten out of it. Make sure to note what the other reviewer said about finding batteries at their local CVS or Walgreens.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Woolard

customer_reviews.title: A joy to have and uae
customer_reviews.text: A must to have without it I would not have seen theses little pest on my plants
customer_reviews.author: D. Fish

customer_reviews.title: Title accurate, size not so much.
customer_reviews.text: This thing was made for a toddler. I can’t use it at all. Trying to hold it and turn the knobs while holding something in your other hand is impossible. I have medium sized hands 😐
customer_reviews.author: TheCleverFox

customer_reviews.title: It's tough to use
customer_reviews.text: It really zooms in on things. However, it's really tough to put it over exactly what I want to look at. It will zoom right down to the nitty-gritty. I drew an ex, on a paper and I had to back it off because the black graphite was so big. . So with some manipulation. I could really zoom in and see something. If you wanted to see scratches on a coin. This would do it. No problem.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but certainly $10 perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Aside from the complaints others mentioned, this thing is great: Sure the lens / view area is too small, but it DOES do 6-100x, and it does it just fine. Genuine issues, the focus and zoom are stiff. They do make it difficult to adjust and remain on target. Those issues aside, for $10 you have a compact 'microscope' that does a great job!
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Loads of fun
customer_reviews.text: Great pocket Microscope, I use it for everything just to see how it looks magnified, would make a great present for any small child as they could explore many different objects. The led light helps to make it much clearer as to what you are looking at.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: LCXL
customer_reviews.text: Works really good see things up close and personal. If you have a cat or dog take a swab of the gunk in ear- see if your cat or dog has ear mites. You will see them- pretty gross!! But any how bought this item for a great price, fast shipping and packaged real good to avoid damged that could happen during shipping. So you can't go wrong with this purchase, great price works really good.
customer_reviews.author: lcxl

customer_reviews.title: Use for a project keep for a toy
customer_reviews.text: I had a project I am working on that I needed to use a microscope. Being a cheapo such as myself I went with the cheapest microscope I could find. This thing works great, its fun looking at your clothes, your couch, your food, your pets.....anything under the microscope and it blows your mind. All my friends love it as well, even got a text the other day asking where I bought it. Its probably not the best or most powerful on the market but does wonders at a sub $20 price point.
customer_reviews.author: Christian K

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This was an amazing buy! It works great for homeschooling.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Littleton

product_meta.title: Carson 60x-75x MicroMax LED Lighted Pocket Microscope (MM-200)
product_meta.description:
Style:Microscope| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingLightweight and portable, the Carson MM-200 MicroMax pocket microscope is ideal for on-the-go science. The MicroMax offers a powerful 60x to 75x magnification range, making it easy to examine blood samples, bugs, and anything else that's worthy of a closer look. The microscope also includes a built-in LED light that provides a bright, clear image, along with a rubberized eyepiece for comfortable viewing. Best of all, the MicroMax fits conveniently in a jacket pocket, so you can bring it along wherever you go--whether it's a school field trip or a visit to a friend's house.

Please note that users must hold this LED pocket microscope flat against the surface in order for the image to come in clear and in focus. It will be difficult to view objects with the microscope tilted at an angle due to the very high magnifications. CAUTION: If a user is viewing a shiny surface, sometimes the bright LED light will cause a glare which causes the image to become over exposed and unclear.

Specifications

Magnification: 60x to 75x
Batteries: 3 SG3 button cell (included)
Dimensions: 1.25 by 3.25 by 0.75 inches (W x H x D)
Weight: 1.1 ounces

Warranty

At Carson, we strive to make sure our customers are 100% satisfied with the quality of our products. We are so confident in our products that we back them with a Lifetime Limited Warranty! Carson will repair or replace your product if it is found to have manufacturing defects in materials or workmanship. Please contact Carson for additional warranty details and trouble-shooting steps at 1-800-9-OPTICS or 631-963-5000.
feature_bullets: Runs on 3 SG3 Button Cell Batteries (Included)
Power and zoom controls (60x-75x magnification) for bright, clear images
So lightweight you can bring it anywhere
Measures 1.25 x 3.25 x 0.75 inches (W x H x D)
